holidays.name: International Fairy Day
holidays.description: A magical day dedicated to celebrating fairies and the enchanting world of folklore and fantasy.
holidays.origin: Rooted in European folklore, this day invites people to honor the mythical creatures known as fairies, believed to bring luck and mischief.
holidays.funFact: In many cultures, fairies are considered nature spirits who can be either helpful or mischievous, depending on their mood!

holidays.name: World UFO Day
holidays.description: A day for UFO enthusiasts to gather, share sightings, and ponder the mysteries of extraterrestrial life.
holidays.origin: Established by UFO researchers to commemorate the first widely publicized UFO sighting on June 24, 1947, by pilot Kenneth Arnold.
holidays.funFact: The term 'flying saucer' was coined after Arnold's sighting when he described UFOs moving like 'saucers skipping on water.'

holidays.name: National Pralines Day (USA)
holidays.description: A sweet holiday dedicated to enjoying pralines, the sugary, nutty confections beloved in the Southern United States.
holidays.origin: Celebrates the classic New Orleans treat made from sugar, cream, butter, and pecans, with French origins dating back to the 17th century.
holidays.funFact: Legend has it that pralines were named after the French diplomat Marshal du Plessis-Praslin, whose chef created the original recipe!

holidays.name: Feast of St. John the Baptist
holidays.description: A traditional Christian feast day commemorating the birth of John the Baptist, featuring bonfires and festivities in many countries.
holidays.origin: Christian liturgical calendar marks June 24 as the birth of St. John the Baptist, with roots going back to medieval times.
holidays.funFact: In some cultures, jumping over bonfires on this night is believed to bring good luck and health for the coming year!
